question:
The reducing agent in the given equations :
<katex>$4~Ag_{(s)}+8~CN_{(aq)}^{-}+2H_{2}O_{(aq)}+O_{2_{(g)}}\rightarrow4[Ag(CN)_{2}]_{(aq)}^{-}+4~OH_{(aq)}^{-}$</katex>
<katex>$2[Ag(CN)_{2}]_{(aq)}+Zn_{(s)}\rightarrow[Zn(CN)_{4}]_{(aq)}^{2-}+2Ag_{(s)}$</katex>
explanation: In the second step of the Mac-Arthur Forrest Cyanide process, Zinc (Zn) displaces Silver (Ag) from the complex.
Zn goes from oxidation state 0 to +2 (Oxidation).
Therefore, **Zn acts as the reducing agent**.
